title: Welcome To STATS141XP
text:
Instructor: Jose Toledo Luna
Office Hours: Friday 12:00pm - 1:00pm 
Both office hours and discussion will be held online through Zoom

title: Welcome To STATS141XP
text:
Make sure to sign up or download the following software (in order)

LaTeX
Overleaf: Online \(\LaTeX\) editor
R/R Studio
Quarto: An open-source scientific and technical publishing system
CiteDrive: Online reference manager which integrates well with Quarto and Overleaf
Git and Github: Version control

We will get to this towards the end of the quarter

Netlify: Website hosting service (sign up using Github account)

title: Jose Toledo Luna
text:

title: Jose Toledo Luna
text:
I am currently a third year Statistics Ph.D. student at University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) working with Hongquan Xu. Prior to joining UCLA, I obtained my BA and MS degrees in Statistics from California State University, Fullerton. You can learn more about me from my CV
I am gratefully funded by the Eugene V. Cota-Robles Fellowship
Email: toledo60@g.ucla.edu

title: Statistics Tutoring
text: Boost your statistics knowledge with my tailored tutoring, grounded in a solid academic foundation with bachelor’s and master’s degrees in statistics, and currently advancing through a PhD in the same field. My teaching experience includes notable universities such as the University of California, Los Angeles, and California State University, Fullerton, covering a wide range of subjects from introductory statistics and college algebra to data science programming, mathematical statistics, and applied statistics in various sciences. I prioritize personalized learning, designing sessions to meet your specific goals and challenges. To explore more about my qualifications and teaching philosophy, I invite you to visit my personal website
